alert.note: Alert for Fannin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 3:10AM CDT until August 22 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Fannin. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bonham, Leonard, Honey Grove, Whitewright, Savoy, Ector, Dodd City, Bailey, Ravenna, Bonham State Park, Trenton, Ladonia, Pecan Gap and Windom.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
